SENT.plain: Severe aplastic anemia is the most serious complication of chrysotherapy
No treatment for this condition has been demonstrated effective
We report 3 patients with gold induced severe aplastic anemia treated with antithymocyte globulin
Complete marrow recovery was obtained in 1 case and a partial but satisfactory response in the other
All the patients remain alive without requiring blood transfusion after followup of longer than 16 months
